definitions.definition: a line of light, electromagnetic waves or particles

examples.text: The car's headlights were on **full beam** *(= shining as brightly as possible and not directed downwards)*.
He played the beam of his torch over the wall of the cave.
The beam from the lighthouse swept over the sea.
He was suddenly caught in the full beam of a searchlight.
They focus a high-powered X-ray beam on the affected area.

definitions.definition: a long piece of wood, metal, etc. used to support weight, especially as part of the roof in a building

examples.text: The cottage had exposed oak beams.
It was a charming cottage with original beams and a thatched roof.
A concrete beam was put in to replace the wall we removed.
The missiles are bolted to reinforced beams in the floor.

definitions.definition: a wooden bar that is used in the sport of gymnastics for people to move and balance on

examples.text: The gymnast performed a somersault on the beam.
Your calculation is way off beam.

wordOrigin: Old English bēam ‘tree, beam’, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch boom and German Baum.
